comments.body: Having the view shake as much as that could make you quite dizzy. I think the current bobbing is enough.

Nathaniel Reynolds does have a point, but I don't think that the tilt would be that intense. I think that it should just be a slight detail to create a bit more immersive ride, rather than your whole view creating a boat effect.
I like this. Would have to make sure it isn't too shaky though.
Yes, it wouldn't be too much tilt, just a little bit to make your ride more immersive. I myself agree to the fact that if it is overdone it would become annoying at some point
I like this idea! Small things like this really make the game unique!

I agree, but Smite's effect on a totem user should wear off in time, perhaps a few minutes. I support this addition, as it gives Smite (an otherwise under-appreciated enchantment) a unique use and offers balance to totem mechanics, but using I don't want using a single totem of undying to doom me to increased damage forever.

I was about to make a post about this exact thing when this one popped up, great to see that I'm not the first to think of this, I hope it will get more votes so that it can eventually get added to the game.
Definitely a good improvement + horses became very useless sicne tehre are far better transportation ways

This seems to have a connection with the Protection enchantments so it must have the rules of the Protection law again: You can't have different kinds of Protection enchants on the same item.

If this had a protection law rule so that it can't be merged with protection enchantments or combined on top of them then this enchantment would have almost no use except it gives 1.6x more health being also rare, creepers or mobs do a lot of damage to player with diamond armor so this enchantment would be bad if it had to be under protection law rule, that's why this is a god set enchantments, all the protection enchantments are old, minecraft does not have any new armour enchantments that are good except mending, that's why Over load will be a rare minecraft enchant that can only be found in End cities.

Even if it's an addition to protection it would be great to have something to grind for or work for.

If those enchantments get added then it would be no problem for them to add it despite protection law rules.

Nice,
good thinking!
I agree a lot. Simple things like this would be awesome to see in the game. It would also improve arrows finally.

The thing about this is, that it would only make sense if we needed to wait 'till the night is over when we were sleeping because technically we still need to wait 'till the night is over in the real world.
I wish this could happen so the stuff you smelt actually is done when your out of bed

Players should have a sleep meter and be able to sleep at any time whenever the meter is low. Sleeping would replenish this bar, and when it is full or when the player chooses they will wake up. This would allow the player to choose to skip certain times of the day. How tired the player is determines how much time can be skipped

On bedrock edition, you can build outwards horizontally by peeking forward over the edge of the block you're standing on and placing a block. This only works if there isn't another block in your reach beyond that. Stand on your scaffolding block, look in the direction you're building, and peek over the edge until you see the selector outline on the block you're stood on, then place.
This should be in the Parity section, but I agree.
Also, 379719724151 - that only works if you are on the top scaffolding block. You cannot do that if you are trying to add a lower branch to an existing scaffolding tower.
just make bedrock work like java
This is also an issue on Xbox. It ca be very annoying when half the scaffolding I want going out goes up or falls down.

Page 1 I imagine the apiary GUI with a slot for empty glass bottles and a slot for the jars filled with honey, with a furnace type arrow between them, which would show how close the bottles are to being filled. Honey jars would be stackable. If you wanted the apiary to produce honeycomb, then there would be an option in the GUI. You would not need bottles for input. There would be a limit to the storage space in the apiary itself, such that you or a hopper would need to collect it before it would produce more. If honey is ever used for anything, the empty bottle would stay in the input slot, similar to milk with the bucket staying in the crafting grid. If you put honeycomb and a bottle in a crafting grid, it would make one honey item, but this would not be the most efficient way to obtain honey. Finally, instead of the particle effect from the apiary, I do imagine a bee mob, which would not be used for swarms because this could cause lag, but any hive or apiary will, shortly after sunrise, spawn a few bee mobs which will wander and look for flowers. If they find an unoccupied flower, they will land on it, stay there for a short time, occasionally a new flower of the same kind will appear nearby if there is space, and the bee will then go back to the hive or apiary. If it is an apiary, the arrow will progress partially.

[please put bee specific feedback in the Bee thread, thanks ~ admin]

I had a very similar idea a few years back. It was based on harvest time to easily calculate when food had gone expired.

If the food was in a chest that had ice in it, it would last longer. If the food was coated in either sugar or salt, then you could extend the life of food. 

My idea was that salt would be a mineral nearby an ocean or obtainable through filtering water. 

Not sure if you could work these ideas into what you currently got. But I would love to see a proper food system to teach people to not take more than you need, cause then it will start to go bad and that would be food waste. It is a big issue in todays society and Minecraft itself could be a way of learning these small skills.
I think the food should be preserved with salt.
That would be great and really useful, though watch out for that tree...

I was so excited when I finally got my Elytra. Then disappointed as I couldn‚Äôt really see the world, since I had to aim with my view. So yes, I‚Äôm all for this change. I want to enjoy the bird-eye view :).

What will be the trajectory when the crouch button is released? Is the view resetted to saved/locked angle, or will the flight trajectory suddenly change to current view?

Even just being able to look around would be a game changer, but I love the additional idea of being able to use items more reliably equally well.

Great suggestion, and I think more people need to be brought to the attention of this concept. Wish I knew some influential creators so we could get the word out.
I created this account just to post this idea, but found you and at least one other already did (not too surprised though).
Best of luck getting this to Mojang and the community. I know we would all greatly appreciate it if it were implemented.

I suggest that the God armour (stackable protection, fire p., blast p. and projectile p. enchantments) that appeared briefly in 1.14.3 should come back but only be possible on gold armour. This gives a reason to use gold armour. It would also introduce this mechanic into the game a way that isn't completely OP. The armour would only last a short time so you could only use it for one boss fight before it would start to break.

Same could work for tools, a sword with sharpness and smite, for example.
Gold's tool durability is only 32 (27 lower than wood) if any buffs were to happen it would be making that much higher, it should be least 45.

–êttack mechanics may be next:
LMC - Blow with two swords
RMC - Block with two swords
Hold RMC - Heavy blow
Hold Shift+LMC - Whirlwind attack

Maybe there should be a longer cooldown effect after swinging since you can deal twice the damage.

And I like the idea of a charge attack, but possibly use or hold LMC then release to use it, plus a cooldown so it cannot be spammed

But for a heavy attack, I think could be a shield/guard breaker since it's hard to get around/attacking a shielding player, to do this you must do a crit attack, aka jump and hit, to break their guard
what if it did work with sharpness but the enchantment "dual blade removes the sweeping edge effect from the sword entirely. also just for fun, there could be back sheaths.
This could be a cool idea, but how do you attack with the second sword on mobile?
This could be a cool idea, but maybe it should simply allow the sword in the offhand to attack when you attack with the sword in the main hand, to simplify the controls
So specific. You got my support!

its inspired by the counters from super smash bros
we could use this for xbox until we get shields
I completely agree the new changes just make the game way more unenjoyable to play and makes the game feel janky.

Absolutely agree. I've been a long-time toggle sprint user, but I intentionally avoid the later versions because I'm having to toggle sprint on every time I open a menu. It's next to impossible to keep track of whether or not sprint is toggled on this way if FOV effects are turned off, and is a huge hassle

The Compass would be a HUD element that shows which direction you‚Äôre facing, such as North, South, East, West, North East, North West, South East, and South West. This would make it much easier for players to see directions while exploring or building in Minecraft Bedrock.
